p: Despite a tremendous amount of media coverage, a large portion of our patient population likely does not understand COVID-19. This disease, caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, is believed to have emerged from a live animal market in Wuhan, China, and was transmitted to humans through close contact; although, there are competing theories on the viral origin. The virus is part of a larger family of viruses called coronaviruses that are single-stranded ribonucleic acid viruses [ 4]. Coronaviruses are not new and classically have caused mild respiratory or gastrointestinal symptoms in humans [ 5]. If the name SARS sounds familiar, it is because there have been two strains related to outbreaks this century to include severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS).
